text: Kale, Apple and Goat Cheese Salad with Granola Croutons
label: title

text: Ingredients
label: header

text: 1 cup old-fashioned oats
label: ingredient

text: ½ cup roughly chopped pecans
label: ingredient

text: ½ cup raw pepitas (hulled pumpkin seeds)
label: ingredient

text: ½ cup raw sunflower seeds
label: ingredient

text: ¼ teaspoon fine sea salt
label: ingredient

text: ¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon
label: ingredient

text: Pinch of cayenne pepper
label: ingredient

text: 1 large egg white, beaten
label: ingredient

text: 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
label: ingredient

text: 1 tablespoon maple syrup or honey
label: ingredient

text: 1 tablespoon lemon juice
label: ingredient

text: 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon smooth Dijon mustard
label: ingredient

text: Hefty pinch of fine sea salt
label: ingredient

text: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
label: ingredient

text: 1 large bunch or 2 small bunches (12 ounces) curly green kale
label: ingredient

text: 1 medium Honeycrisp, Granny Smith or Fuji apple
label: ingredient

text: 2 ounces chilled goat cheese, crumbled (about ½ cup)
label: ingredient

text: ¼ cup chopped dried cranberries
label: ingredient

text: Instructions
label: header

text: To make the granola: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit and line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean-up. In a medium bowl, stir together the oats, pecans, pepitas, sunflower seeds, salt, cinnamon and cayenne pepper. Stir in the beaten egg white, oil, and maple syrup until well blended. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking sheet and bake until golden, gently stirring the granola halfway, about 15 to 17 minutes. Let the granola cool on the baking sheet.
label: step

text: To make the dressing: In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, maple syrup and salt. Season with a generous amount of freshly ground black pepper and whisk until blended. The dressing should be zippy, but if it’s overwhelmingly tart, stir in another teaspoon of sweetener. Or, if it needs some extra oomph, stir in another pinch of salt.
label: step

text: To prepare the kale, use a chef’s knife to remove the tough ribs from the kale, then discard the ribs (or feed them to your dog!). Chop the kale leaves into small, bite-sized pieces. Transfer the chopped kale to a big salad bowl. Sprinkle a small pinch of sea salt over the kale and massage the leaves with your hands by lightly scrunching big handfuls at a time, until the leaves are darker in color and fragrant.
label: step

text: To assemble the salad, drizzle all of the dressing over the kale and toss well. Add the chopped apple, crumbled goat cheese, cranberries, and about half of the granola. Gently toss to combine, and serve. This salad will keep well, covered and refrigerated, for up to 4 days.
label: step

text: Save the leftover granola for a snack or another salad. Store it in an air-tight bag with the air squeezed out for up to 2 weeks at room temperature, or several months in the freezer.
label: step
